page.title: 09Springfield House.
page.content: Springfield House was originally 196 acres, but now it is much smaller. There were many owners:The Fishers and Richard Moland,1739_1798,The Boultbees,1798_1904,the Jacksons 1912_1941,and now finally it has been turned into a boarding school for disadvantaged children. Before Springfield House was built there was another house in its place, the floorboards of the present house came from the former one. When the Jackson family bought the house in 1912 they made changes,the glass conservatory was knocked down and made into a ballroom.In the 2nd World War the stables were used as a hospital and a sort of tent was put up as extra area.The old walled kitchen gardens have been turned into a nature reserve and recreation area and only the apple trees remain.
